website_summaries.verdict: Handsomely designed iron creates clean and precise waffles.
pros: Sturdy design looks good in a  kitchen, too
Comes with a measuring cup for consistent waffles
Customers also report waffles taste similar to those made by professionals
Ideal for those with many mouths to feed
cons: Large and may be difficult to store

customer_reviews.title: There's good and bad
customer_reviews.text: The good: The machine makes waffles, which are crisp, on the outside, while soft and fluffy, on the inside. The bad: 1) the waffle plates are not removable, for cleaning and, so far, with only one use, that's not a problem; the plates did easily wipe clean, 2) the unit takes about 5 minutes, to preheat, to operating temperature, 3) the provided electrical cord is short and needs an extension, unless you can get it within about 2 feet of a wall socket, 4) the outside of the waffle-making area gets very hot and 5) the unit takes almost a half hour, to cool, after being used.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hungerford

customer_reviews.title: Broke after handful of times, save your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for Christmas for use at our vacation place. We used it only 6 to 8 times and the latching mechanism no longer works. It creates a huge mess of oozing batter. Unbelievable. A complete waste of money. So disappointed that I trusted a name brand.
customer_reviews.author: vw

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped well. Product box seams came apart in shipping, but it was well protected inside. This is working well and keeps up with feeding our family of five. As long as you spray the grids before each fill, waffles lift out easily. The included measuring cup has a handle that makes it convenient to hang on the side of the batter bowl between uses. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laur Reads (Clean & Proper Romance, Suspense, Historical, Fantasy, Women's fiction))

customer_reviews.title: Plastic in which the wires are contained which is cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had this waffle maker for 7 months and it is broken. The part that makes the waffle rotate broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Marquita

customer_reviews.title: Makes legit Belgian waffles, not sad Eggos.
customer_reviews.text: The chicken and waffles photo is from a cooking class I took with a pretty sad waffle iron. It had poor temperature control and made pretty sad soggy waffles. The half eaten waffle with cherry chips is my first waffle I made on this iron. This is a legit machine that can make crisp exteriors with fluffy soft insides. The waffles come out cleanly but if you add melty items inside, you'll want to give it a good wipe. I wrapped a chopstick up in a small piece of damp paper towel and easily cleaned up in between the grooves. I'm extremely pleased with this waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Beeps Comstantly - not cooked
customer_reviews.text: Use this waffle maker once and it did not even work. The unit turned on and continue to beep without stopping. We called Cuisinart they told us to unplug it for an hour and try it again. We did that and the unit still as it warms up beeps constantly. We then called again and they told us to try cooking a waffle. We did that and as soon as you put the battery in and rotate it it starts beeping and never stops. Finally Cuisinart said to get a hold of Amazon to return it. Do not recommend this product at all
customer_reviews.author: Tamara behm

customer_reviews.title: America's Test Kitchen FAIL: Flimsy and broke after minimal uses. VERY disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this waffle iron because it was recommended by America's Test Kitchen. After about 3 uses, the rotating hinge broke. My husband is handy, so he repaired it and we have been able to use it about 8 more times after the repair. This morning, the heating element in the middle stopped working, so the waffles cooked on the top, but not the middle. For as infrequently as we make waffles, we should have had this waffle maker for decades; not so much. This is the second Cuisinart appliance I have purchased that HAS NOT lived up to expectations. Not impressed with the brand. It's supposed to be a more premium brand. Premium CRAP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read this!
customer_reviews.text: So here is the deal, this is not a commercial waffle iron. At least according to cuisinart. Although they market is as one. They designed It to appear commercial, and they probably sell lots of them as a result of the commercial amazon search description. As for value, they work great, at least for a 80. Waffle iron. However, buyer beware. Do Not tell Warrantee dept if you own a restaurant. Fine print: for residential use only. They will not honor warrantee if you do. 2 stars due to deceptive marketing. I’ve bought at least 30 of these waffle irons in the past few years. For the price, they are hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Q. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: [waring pro is owned by cuisinart] It’s not as nice as the old waring pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom as a Christmas present after she had been admiring my old waring pro. [waring pro is owned by cuisinart] It’s not as nice as the old waring pro, not all parts appear to be stainless and I’m disappointed that it doesn’t have a removable drip tray. The cup line is off and if you use it, your waffles will be on the small side. But it did makes perfectly gorgeous waffles, each side has its own light and independent timer.
customer_reviews.author: bettyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Hinge is defective
customer_reviews.text: Made decent waffles but..I had a Waring, which is the same as Cuisinart. both are owned by con-air. Look at the reviews..almost all problems are due to the cheap plastic hinge breaking. When I contacted them they said they didn't make this anymore and couldn't help me. Never offered to send a Cuisinart as replacement, just anything not to stand behind their product. By the way, I also bought one for my daughter, but came in as Cuisinart, not Waring. This is how I found out they are the same, just Google it. JUNK..JUNK..JUNK...save your money and buy from a different company!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, waffles came out great. My first waffle was a little over, see picture, at setting 5 (1-6). I adjusted the settings down and the result was better. It took about 5 minutes to cook two big waffles. I am very glad I will add waffle to our family breakfast menu to feed 6!
customer_reviews.author: Deep Breath - Fast Run

customer_reviews.title: SO, SO, SO SAD
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this waffle maker! Worked like a champ for about 6 months and then like many of the reviews, the plastic hinge that houses the wires broke. I carefully continued to use it- but now I am afraid that it could become a safety hazard because of the exposed wires. I do not write reviews on anything I haven't used for at least 6 months for this very reason! Cuisinart, PLEASE DO BETTER!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this since Father's Day, and we love it. We even took it on Vacation with us. It is extremely easy to keep clean and it's very, very nice to make two waffles at once. Before then we were making little Mickey Mouse waffles and it would take my husband an hour+ from start to clean up. Now we are cooking two big fluffy waffles at a time, and he's able to make other breakfast things while they cook. It's a pretty tough appliance, too. Fell out of the back of our Van on the pavement when my husband opened the hatch to get something out of our luggage. Still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Latch Never Completely Closes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this waffle maker after my Waring Pro broke. The Waring Pro (discontinued product) made perfect waffles -- crisp and golden on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside. This Cuisinart pales in comparison. I bought one unit and the latch failed to close completely - causing the batter in the center of the waffle to not cook thoroughly. I exchanged that unit and the new one had the same problem. It's been sitting in my cabinet for over a year...I should have returned it. I agree with all of the other reviewers who say that the craftsmanship is poor. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: PBYDesign

customer_reviews.title: 2 waffles at once! Custom doneness!
customer_reviews.text: Waited until I had used this waffle iron many times before writing a review. The quality is really good. There is a light indicator when the iron is hot and when the contents is cooked. I have cooked chicken as waffles, brownies and regular waffle mix. All came out great bc there is a dial just like your toaster...light to dark. The chicken was a mess to clean but that was my choice. If you fill properly and it takes time to get used to the correct amount cleanup is easy. Oh yes, there is a cup for exact measurement which will help you....if you can find the cup when you need it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Swenson

customer_reviews.title: I must have gotten a dud! My waffle make sucked.
customer_reviews.text: Returning this item that I was really hoping to like. Used it for the first time this morning.. One side is only cooking half a waffle, so one nice brown side and one white side. It didn't beep 6 times like the book said..it just kept beeping and beeping and beeping. No trouble shooting info in the manual so I have no clue why it keep beeping. After trying to make two waffles, I tried to just make one in that side that only cooked half and it did the same thing. Needless to say this being returned tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Topasna

customer_reviews.title: Makes great waffles 2 at a time
customer_reviews.text: What I like best is the ability to cook 2 waffles at a time. Really cuts down on the long wait when trying to feed more than 2 people. I deducted 1 star because they changed the measuring cup but not the instructions. The instructions show a fill line on the included plastic cup for measuring the correct amount of batter to get a complete waffle without over filling the waffle iron. The cup that came with mine does not have a fill line. Yet the instructions say to fill cup to the fill line. A full cup does the trick but it took some trial and error to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Blues 'n BBQ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: Oh wow are we excited about this waffle iron! It checks almost every single box. We can make 2 at a time, it fits on a shelf, it’s a nice even toasting on the waffles, they are Belgian waffles that are super thick and oh so nice, the machine feels so sturdy and high quality when you flip the waffles, and it looks straight up badass and professional. The only thing it’s lacking is the ability to clean it. I don’t think you can remove the grills without disassembling it. But we don’t care, we will just get it super hot, burn the germs, and wipe it clean with a soapy cloth. It’s seriously a fantastic waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a flip waffle maker so some time now. Read some reviews and decided I would give this one a try, loved that it was a double waffle maker. I can't count how many times we have used this, it's been rock steady. I purchased on 2/2018 ish and can't complain, treat things with respect and they will last.
customer_reviews.author: redtimmy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waffle maker. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent waffle maker. Upgrading from an Oster single waffle maker. The thermostat is perfect. The instructions suggest heat level 4 and that's spot on. The audible alert is perfectly timed and hasn't missed yet. The measuring cup that comes with the unit is there perfect size--complete waffles without spill-over. I love the attention to detail and the thought that obviously went into the design.
customer_reviews.author: brnt

customer_reviews.title: It’s “okay”
customer_reviews.text: I was SUPER excited to purchase this item. One of my favorite things to do on the weekend is to make Belgian waffles (with assorted fruit toppings). I was a little disappointed. When I made the waffles, the waffle iron will “pop” open. I’m not sure if my mix is too condensed which expands and pops it up but this caused uneven heating issues. The parts that were brown and crispy were very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: We Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We have 5 kids and need to make waffles fast! Love the two sides. Works great! Waffles came out delicious. I wish the cord were a bit longer but I love how the cord tucks underneath the unit when we are not using it!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Burke

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my 80 year old Dad and he is now a waffle making madman!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because America's Test Kitchen said it was the best, and I am so glad I did. I bought it for my 80 year old Father who really wanted decent waffles and could not get one when all the restaurants were closed due to the pandemic. Now my Father is not at all dumb but the machine cannot be overly complicated or he would get annoyed and give up. It has been 2 months and he is still going! I love how happy my Dad is with his gift and the constant stream of waffle pics he sends me are adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Lara G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this belgian waffle maker...ordered another for another location...
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly as ordered and expected. The instructions for packing and delivery were quite disappointing. This was to be delivered to a boat dock. It was supposed to be packaged with an outside box so the contents would not be known. It was delivered to a boat repair shop and the box told them exactly what was inside. I had specific instructions which was totally ignored and not mentioned on the delivery ticket. I had to track the package down!
customer_reviews.author: T. Feiss

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as we were missing our local breakfast place and wanted to create our own Belgian Waffle experience. We splurged on the double waffle maker that can make 2 at a time and I'm glad we did. Temp control means we can determine how crispy we want the outside of the waffle to be. it says to use non-stick spray, but didn't and it came out fine. The appliance is large, in size, so storage in our small kitchen was an issue until we re-organized. Very happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!!!! I saw someone at work with this, and I had to have it!! It cooks the waffles evenly and you can cook two at one time, with three kids there is minimal standing around waiting on your waffle. Great Quality
customer_reviews.author: NickyRyvers

customer_reviews.title: Double the yumminess!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Cuisinart double Belgian waffle maker. There are 6 settings that allow you to choose how brown the waffles get. Clean up is simple as well. I usually forget to apply cooking spray, oil, or butter, but I haven't had a problem with the waffles sticking. I've been using the NYT Easy Weekend Waffle recipe. Definitely use the included measuring cup. One scoop, or a little less, is enough for 1 waffle. Our family of 6 will get years of use out of this waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Makes 2 at once. Both turn out the same
customer_reviews.text: The waffle maker we got for a wedding gift died after 4 years. Decided to try this double waffle iron. It makes 2 at a time, both come out crisp, fluffy and gorgeously colored. Very pleased to have cut waffling time in half. May need to adjust the rest of your breakfast cooking accordingly. Usually bake bacon, and start it when I start cooking waffles. With doubling the waffle rate, bacon/sausage can go in partway through waffling.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have to spend a bunch of time at the waffle maker trying to feed my family!! This thing pops out 2 waffles AT THE SAME DARN TIME!!! It's super easy to use, comes with a measuring cup, easy to clean, the cord has a place underneath the unit where it wraps up for storage, it's pretty. I especially love that it actually beeps when the waffles are done!! I can be in the next room and still hear it!! No more standing there all useless waiting for a light to turn green!!! Get this waffle maker!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: This newer model is missing the red/green light that shows it’s on/warmed up and the dial for heat level seems loose like it controls nothing
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace ours which fell apart after a couple years. This newer model is missing the red/green light that shows it’s on/warmed up and the dial for heat level seems loose like it controls nothing. This one beeps when it’s ready but if it’s noisy with kids waiting for breakfast or you step away and miss it, you never know. Other than putting in batter too soon bc I wasn’t sure if it beeped or not (it seems to take 10 mins plus to preheat) it cooks the same. Adjusting the temp knob doesn’t seem to affect cooking temp or time IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Belgian waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: I love waffles for breakfast, Belgian or regular. What drew me to this iron is the fact you can make two waffles at the same time by spinning (flipping) it over. It was a novelty that caught my eye. We first used it with company over and everyone loved the waffles and spinning the iron to make a second one. The waffles turned out great, even though we just used regular waffle batter. When the light came on and the (somewhat quiet) beeper beeped, the waffles were perfect. I sprayed a spray cooking oil lightly on the iron between each waffle and have never had one stick, so cleaning is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to warm up
customer_reviews.text: Great waffle maker. Feels and works like a hotel waffle maker. My only issue is that it takes an eternity to warm up. So if your kids eat at different times before School. Once it's hot you better leave it on. It's actually rediculous how long it takes to be ready for the batter. For this reason I will not give it 5 stars. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Just 5 month of use and it died, without any reasons
customer_reviews.author: Irakli

customer_reviews.title: Makes great waffles
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a durable waffle maker, this unit falls into that category. It was purchased to be used in a restaurant and has held up to daily use. It makes crispy, golden Belgian style waffles in a short amount of time. With the nonstick coating, cleanup is easy. You can easily adjust the desired crispness of the waffles by using the heat control knob. The beeper is wonderful at letting you know when the golden deliciousness that awaits you is ready. I highly recommend this machine if you want to make multiple delicious waffles with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for a Little Over a Year
customer_reviews.text: My family loved this waffle iron. We used it heavily since June of 2019 when we purchased it from Amazon, but last night it broke to much consternation from my kids. It broke at the hinge point in the back, like many others have stated. I would love to get another one, but would like something that lasts more than 14 months, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Keith G.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING waffles!
customer_reviews.text: We looked at several models online, including a single version of this model. After watching the videos, we decided on the double waffle maker. Our first use made PERFECT waffles. The unit is easy to clean, easy to use and you can expect AMAZING waffles EVERY time. We are looking forward to enjoying fresh Belgian style waffles whenever we want to make them. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: John Hainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Better Hinge Attachment Needed
customer_reviews.text: Nice machine and function controls are easy. My only issue with this unit is that on the (2) that I have purchased, both units cracked then broke at the hinge / swivel attachment to the base. The casting is in my opinion very weak and need to be reinforced or redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Time saver!!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had a manufacturers defect (small clump of coating on waffle iron). When I wiped it off, it came off exposing the metal underneath. I informed Amazon and received a replacement right away. Postage was paid for my return item. I'm a prime member (not sure if thats the case with non-prime members). Item works fantastic!!! I love that I can adjust the setting for how dark I want the waffles to cook. Cooking 2 waffles at the same time saves me much time in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Dizzydelli

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I loved it, great waffle maker and makes 2 at the same time. It comes with measuring cup, 1 full cup is one waffle. So fill it up so they could come out nice . I used temperature 4, they come out nice in color.
customer_reviews.author: Juan D Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Fragile, Fragile, Fragile
customer_reviews.text: This is the second waffle iron like this I have purchased and both ended with the same result. As you can see in the pictures the back of the iron has come off rendering the iron as useless. I had the same problem with the first one a single maker and both of them made it to the trash in under 3 years. If you make waffles regularly this is not the item for you to buy. Other than that it worked great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy thos waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working with less than 3 uses. Top plates do not heat and lights stopped as well.
customer_reviews.author: MikeVan

customer_reviews.title: I hate this waffle maker.  Never crispy waffles
customer_reviews.text: Have had this since April. The highest setting, #6, isn't hot enough to make crispy waffles. Waffles just dry out but remain white-ish.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Ocasio

customer_reviews.title: Professional Waffles at Home!! 😎
customer_reviews.text: I love going on vacation at hotels that offer breakfast with waffle makers. So now I can use the same professional waffle maker in my own kitchen. How cool is that, my family loves the full size waffles. The instruction are so easy my 8 year old could make waffles for Mother’s Day. It has a nonstick surface and the clean up was a breeze. It makes 2 waffles at the same time. I used box pancake mix it was great, I used the waffle recipe they send with the waffle maker and the waffles turned out awesome!!! They were fluffy inside and just firm enough on the outside. The best purchase I made this year.
customer_reviews.author: theresa

customer_reviews.title: I loved it while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I loved it while it worked. After using it probably 6 times the nonstick surface started to stick. Yes I cleaned it after each use, and no I didn't scratch the surface. Then, like other reviews have mentioned,the back hinge cover snapped off. Honestly I was treating this iron very carefully ( given the price) but at this price I can't afford to replace it and have it happen again. Im looking for a different model.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a work of art
customer_reviews.text: The flip function is so smooth. The look of the entire thing is so sleek. Nothing sticks. So easy to wipe down. I really love it. Takes some breaking in. The waffles were coming out much better at the end of a double batch than they were in the beginning. They come out looking just like the big ones you would order at a restaurant. I dont know why I waited so long to purchase this. Waffles were always such a chore making them one at a time. This makes it a much more enjoyable way to cook breakfast. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: KRocque

customer_reviews.title: Anemic waffles
customer_reviews.text: Our previous waffle iron (different brand) stopped working so we decided to buy a new one. I had high hope for Cuisine Art, but this has been disappointing. The waffles turn out very pale and soft no matter which number on the dial is selected. If we leave them in for a longer period of time they are still pale but turn hard. We have used the same recipe for many years, always with fantastic results. Crisp golden brown waffles. This waffle maker can’t seem to do that. We are very sad.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Katornson

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: We've really loved using this waffle maker. It's so easy our 8 year old son has no problems operating it. The waffles come out perfectly browned according to the level we put on it which is great. It's not hard to clean which I was really worried about when I got it, but fortunately all of the mix comes off pretty easily. Some of the water gets down into the base of the unit but I just tip it over until it's emptied out. I don't think there is much electrical parts there so I'm not overly worried but so far it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M. Krause

customer_reviews.title: A Must have for WAFFLE lovers
customer_reviews.text: The waffle maker shipped out and arrived on time. Packaged very well. Besides looking great and being a double waffle maker, It's very well made and very solid. I purchased this here on sale as a Christmas gift for my wife. My wife has been wanting one of these for a while. She loves this waffle maker and uses it a lot. It makes great waffles. Wife was churning out waffles like crazy. I would recommend and buy again if needed
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: Great for couples!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are now empty nesters and this machine is perfect for us as it would be for couples. The ability to make 2 waffles at once gives us the ability to actually have meals together instead of one of us waiting for the other waffle to be made. Heats up equally on both sides, easily cleaned, and fairly quick. Each side has a light to let you know when that waffle is done and even a beeper in case you’re not paying attention. We love this machine and hope it lasts us a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: nusparkey

customer_reviews.title: Good product and quality.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived and was in perfect condition, no damage and the boxing was extra strong. We tried it right away and it worked fine. It would have been awesome if you could take the plates out to clean but it cleans really good anyways. We are satisfied and the waffle maker is sturdy to
customer_reviews.author: Denise Simon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - not as easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint about this is not being able to take the plates out for cleaning. Wiping them down after each use is kind of a pain. If we used this every day, that would get old fast. We have used the double-sided waffles at same time and that works just fine. The cooking spray runs out the sides as they are turned, so that adds to the mess to clean up. But, the temp control seems to work just fine. We use 3 for regular waffles and 4 for chaffles. Overall, happy with my purchase but I will look for removable plates the next time I buy a waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Glkibe

customer_reviews.title: Love It! You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! I love it and so does my family. I’ve made Emerald’s Belgian waffles. Cooks perfectly, easy to use & clean. Best waffle iron purchase yet! Highly recommend this item. It’s just like the hotel waffle irons but better because you can make 2 at a time. Came not so discreetly usually amazon has a box over the original box but not this time so I’m happy I ran into the delivery person before someone could see it and steal it since so many Porch pirates are out there watching and following the drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Clifton-Orosz

customer_reviews.title: Golden, delicious waffles....yea, 2 in about 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, twice the goodness of fresh waffles. Make sure to not forget the fruit, nuts, bacon inside your hot and delicious waffles. We seem to have not put this away yet. This is a good thing. We can easily mix up a batch of batter and after a quick spraying of the surface and pouring of the batter, out comes a golden waffle. The best setting is 3.5 on the one we have. Definately suggest getting one. It's like every morning at the Hampton!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Works great, for cooking lots of waffles
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, to cook waffles for 15 people. They worked great, the high power (1000+ watts) cooked two waffles in less than five minutes (that's almost a waffle per minute, with two of them!). My only minor nit was that the darkest setting was not dark enough for all-buckwheat waffles, so I had to guestimate a bit. Even though the plates are not removable, they were very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Crispy Waffles Quickly - What a Treat!
customer_reviews.text: The weight is enough to help keep a steady temperature on the cooking plates. The deep divots stay crispy too, and hold plenty of peanut butter (my favorite) and syrup. And no doubt about it, being able to consistently cook two waffles helps to quickly feed a group of people. So far, after cooking at least 30 waffles on this appliance, everything has been perfect - zero complaints (so far) - thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Bud Boggy

customer_reviews.title: We have waffles every morning! This is a great Belgian Waffle Maker!
customer_reviews.text: We have made a dozen waffles twice now. It is easy to use, easy to clean up. The measuring cup makes the perfect size waffle. We use a recipe that calls for whipping the egg whites. Makes a very fluffy waffle. The waffles are at least one inch thick, beautiful waffles! Our previous waffle maker took 8 mins for each waffle. Able to make the waffles much more quickly, about three mins each. We freeze the waffles and then heat them up in the morning. Excellent Belgian Waffle Maker!
customer_reviews.author: JosyMaude

customer_reviews.title: Vegan Waffles Comes Out Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I like the convenience of the double waffle maker. It shortens my time making the waffles. They comes out crispy and brown just the way I like them. Of course you can set the gauge on how crispy or soft you want them. They are done when the waffle maker beeps, which takes the quest work out of wondering if they are ready or not. Since I make vegan waffles, I am very pleased with how the come out. It is definitely worth your while if you are interested in a double waffle maker. I had used my daughter's single waffle maker and loved it so much that I decided to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: MFS

customer_reviews.title: Breakfast is ON!
customer_reviews.text: Breakfast has a new face and it's our Cuisinart WAF-F20 Double Belgian Waffle Maker! Had all my sister's and brother's over just to enjoy our waffle maker and everyone loved them - once you figure out what is the best temperature to cook your waffles - it's like automatic - my wife now has it dialed in perfectly and waffles are now a staple to our weekend breakfast - Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dad in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: How Much Counter Space Do You Have?
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several different waffle makers and (at least so far) this one is a gem -- works great, easy to use. Works well with yeasted and non-yeasted batters. The only minor drawback is that it's big -- how much extra counter space do you have? You're going to want somewhere to store this while not in use. Other MINOR drawback is that it does not come apart -- no running it through the dishwasher. Having said that, clean up does seem easy.
customer_reviews.author: Glen B. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: My favorite waffle iron yet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is very easy to use, definitely a step up from your regular waffle iron. The thing I live the best is the timer, it goes off when the waffle is nice and golden brown
customer_reviews.author: Nicollette

customer_reviews.title: Best Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better kitchen appliance purchases that I've made. It makes 2 waffles within 8 minutes. I like the easy cleaning and the manual temp control. It looks good on the island and it's usually a conversation piece when people come over. Makes nice fluffy waffles. We take the remaining batter and make some extras to freeze and toast later for future breakfasts. So far so good.... everything works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: GILDO

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this previously but unfortunately my nephew dropped it and broke it. I loved it so much that I ended up buying the same one again after a year of using another brand. This particular waffle maker cooks everything evenly. I use non-stick cooking spray on mine and everything comes off very easily without sticking. Plus you can make 2 at the same time! How cool is that? I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best Waffles Ever
customer_reviews.text: I may be biased (as I coming from a dinky $20 waffle maker) but I also eat waffles nearly every day. The waffle iron is super easy to use! It beeps to let you know when it is done and widen it has preheated. I like my waffles crispy on the outside and soft and hot on the inside and this definitely does the job! I leave them in about 30 seconds or so longer to get them extra crispy when set on 6 then I place them on a paper towel so they don’t get soggy. Beautiful waffles every time. This product changed my breakfasts. You won’t regret buying this 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cooks perfect waffles to your liking.
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker makes perfect waffles, whether you use a boxed mix or homemade batter. The key is the ability to adjust since different temp/time is required for perfect results with various batters. The included measuring cup ensures that iron is neither overfilled nor underfilled. Preheats quickly and efficiently, cooks 2 large waffles in less than 3 minutes. Is ideal for large gatherings. Waffles are beautifully crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. Adjustment allows you to cook them to your ideal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this yesterday during Prime day and it arrived today. Unfortunately it is broken. As soon as I turned it on it heated up and started to continuously beep. The indicator light did not come on at all. The knob is cheap plastic. The elements holding the metal together to rotate are plastic. I would not recommend this product at all. Extremely cheap design and not worth the price at all. It wouldn’t even be worth a fraction of the price. Also the manual has no trouble shooting information for the beeping.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Fire house approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the Fire house. We have 14 people eating each morning. We found this unit to operate better and more efficiently then others in the past. The fact that it makes 2 big waffles at a time helps us out since we can be called out at a moments notice. We would have liked the pans to have come out for cleaning but it still is easy to clean. Very easy to use and comes out golden brown every time. Highly recommend this unit. Cost more but worth it. Members of BCFD APPROVED
customer_reviews.author: ED Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Danger of Being Burned
customer_reviews.text: This waffle Maker does not have a warning light indicating it has been turned on and is therefore hot. The surface is in fact very hot when it has been turned on and is an invitation to severely burn oneself unknowingly if you happen to brush up against it. Or forget to turn it off. If you have children, watch out, they too can easily burn themselves. I find it hard to believe that this unit was allowed to go on the market at all. It is cheap plastic simulating metal. It will not even register with Cusinart using the Model number (WAF-F20) etched on the unit. Shame on Cusinart for stooping so low.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a splurge item for me. I love the dual waffle ability as the whole process goes by so much quicker. If you are tired of always eating last and by yourself after everyone else is finished it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty

customer_reviews.title: Don’t over fill !
customer_reviews.text: Took several attempts before we got the temperature right. Definitely had to add oil to batter to get crispy outside. Very easy to overfill and then you have a mess. Clean up can be a bit challenging so getting the batter amount right is crucial Being able to make 2 at a time is great.
customer_reviews.author: MCB

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this waffle maker. Now I can serve my waffles as I make them. I do use Pam on the waffle plates and to be safe I gently place a dish towel between the plates before spraying them to keep it off the coils, not using any pressure just laying it over the top. My old waffle maker “died” because the spray got on the coils and eventually went into the motor. It wasn’t a Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: JMV

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 6 months of use... used it less than 20 times. Will no longer heat up. Sure it is under warranty but I have to spend money shipping it to them PLUS enclose a $10 money order with the shipment. Huge waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: I loved this waffle maker until it decided to fall apart after the third use!! I would keep it safely tucked away in the original packaging between uses for safe keeping, but apparently that didn’t matter since on the forth use the whole back part broke off. Up until then it was great, but if simply opening the plate makes it crack and break, I would say the product is made of pretty cheap materials! Waste of $70!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Slezak

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Crispy Waffles
customer_reviews.text: This iron outperforms the Bella 13991 Waffle Iron that it replaced. It heats up quickly, and unlike the Bella, waffles come out crisp and golden brown (rather than soggy). My kids appreciate the fact that it can cook 2 waffles at a time (although they can still eat waffles faster than I can cook them - I'm unsure that there's a waffle iron out there than can match their appetites). Waffles do not stick to the grates, and the surface is easy to clean. I highly recommend this waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Cooks my waffles really well
customer_reviews.text: I priced out so many and looked at so many reviews for a new waffle iron. I’m very picky! I went with this one and never regretted that decision. It cleans nicely. It’s cooks the waffles pretty darn evenly. It’s not a huge, inconvenient thing to store. Highly recommened, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use/high quality product
customer_reviews.text: I learned that my colleague didn’t have a waffle maker for her family, so I got this for her...and it looked so fun that I got one for myself. She loves it...I love it. It is fun and easy to use. It works so fast making perfect waffles quickly so that the whole family can eat at the same time. It is a good looking high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Makes great waffles fast. It is also two sided so they come out fast if you have guests. I even used it to make hash browns which turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Horrible to clean if you make a Liege waffles
customer_reviews.text: Horrible to clean if you make liege waffles. Really horrible. It takes me longer to clean than it does to make the waffles. Otherwise fine. Makes good waffles in the Belgian style and even includes a good recipe. But I’m getting rid of it because the grids can’t be removed for cleaning. Really, really bad design choice.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging and handling
customer_reviews.text: It came in the Cuisinart box with no additional packaging. the box look like it had been dropped, there were tears in it and someone had opened the box and resealed it with clear tape that tore through the label... I was very unhappy about this... The temperature control has a large amount of play in the switch so it's hard to tell exactly what temperature it's on.. And when you feel the plates with mixtures it has a tendency not to stay closed... Other than that it works good and makes good waffles...
customer_reviews.author: Soulbro#1

customer_reviews.title: Big, deep, delicious Belgian waffles
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly built and easy to use machine. And it makes the best, most consistent waffles of any waffle maker I've ever used-- big, deep pockets, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. I read lots of professional reviews before picking this. This had consistently high ratings and they seem well deserved. It seems like the best option on the market as of early 2020, even though there are much more expensive brands, like All Clad. One tiny quibble... the included recipe book has very time-consuming recipes and the results, though delicious, aren't appreciably better than some easy commercial mixes.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Buy a diffferent one
customer_reviews.text: Useless. 5 attempts, every time it overflows when you turn it over and then of course the remaining batter is burnt and hollow. So you clean for min 30 mins and try again. Spent maybe 5 hours yesterday trying to make a passable waffle, less liquid, more, smaller amounts - nothing works. Hate it.
customer_reviews.author: MattHarlem

customer_reviews.title: Anti stick coating comes off and is then useless!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of junk. The anti stick coating wears off fast and then is useless!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ratings Don't Lie
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Waring Pro that was 15 years old, and it's no longer made?? A bad GFCI outlet was the cause, FYI Anyway, I only use one side since I have no friends, but the very first use was awesome, putting the dial at midpoint - 3 1/2 and it was fine. I moved it up to 4, and now the outside is just barely crisp, but a nice brown shade. Aunt Jemima es great.works really well, you just need water, and tastes great too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Makes tasty waffles, but the hinge broke
customer_reviews.text: We liked the ability to make two waffles at once, but the hinge to flip the waffles broke after 1 year of use. It was also not that easy to clean, as the maker is rotated perpendicular during cooking and drips often leaving stains. Oil spray on waffle surface is hard to clean too
customer_reviews.author: jordan pond

customer_reviews.title: We love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: ...the plastic housing feels flimsy and cheap compared to the rest of the device. The actual irons feel solid and appear well-built. We're still playing with the right waffle mix and temperature setting for our taste, but the experiments have all been delicious. Dinged it one star for the cheap-feeling housing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: If you like waffles...
customer_reviews.text: If you like waffles, this is a great double waffle iron. So far so good. We have been enjoying it so far. Very good construction. Not flimsy like other cheaper brands. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Donato C. Rinaldi, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: Waffle crackhead...
customer_reviews.text: So here is the deal. The machine base is sturdy but the flippy mechanism is a lil questionable. It’s a b#%ch to clean because the plates don’t remove. Even with all that I don’t care because i’m now a waffle crackhead. Love em, lost my job, the house the kids and wife over these damn good waffles. So in the end I now live under a bridge with just my waffle machine and I and we are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Brewer

customer_reviews.title: BEST WAFFLES EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!! Best waffles EVER! Broke open the box, followed the instructions. Mixed up a batch of Krusteez waffle mix and went to town. It did not disappoint. The whole family loved them. Waffle pockets are deep, just like in the restaurant. Watch the video on the Amazon listing. Very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great waffle maker. My wife loves it, and I love it because she makes waffles for me with it. I would recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Parese-enterprise

customer_reviews.title: Best waffle maker, worth the splurge!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is worth the splurge over other waffle makers, especially if you are cooking for more than 1! The fact that this so easily makes two fluffy waffles allows for quick and easy breakfasts in our households.
customer_reviews.author: RVS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: This waffle iron has performed very well. I have used it for two years now and I have had no issues. My only complaint would be that it is a little hard to clean as the plates are not removable, but the non-stick finish is great and usually a stiff nylon brush is all you need. I am glad that I purchased this brand and not a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: Baggy Pants

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, Best waffles ever...
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use..good size waffles, excellent heat control..I even gave several of these to friends for Christmas I liked mine so much..
customer_reviews.author: Gary C Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great waffle maker it took a bit of time to get used to the beats and what they meant. In the manual I’m not sure where it says to put the temp on 4 but after using it I found 1-2 works better for me, not sure if it is my altitude where I live or...I love that you can make two at a time. Easy to clean and use just give it a chance and play with the temps to see what works for you Hope this helped
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORKED--still waiting for a replacement or refund
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box, my waffle maker would not heat up. I've been going back and forth with Cuisinart a for a few months now. I'm still waiting for a replacement or refund.
customer_reviews.author: California Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best Waffle Maker we've had yet
customer_reviews.text: I make waffles weekly for my family of 5. It always took a long time to make a full batch but when my old waffle maker stopped working it was a blessing in disguise. This one makes them twice as quick and is easy to use. I would give 5 stars except that you do have to remember to season it with oil before each use for best results. Without the oil the waffles do stick making it difficult to peal them off. However, with a bit of oil before you turn it on this is no longer a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Makes the most perfect waffles!
customer_reviews.text: Love this waffle iron. I was still using the old one I received as a wedding gift 25 years ago. It is a much-needed upgrade. Can't imagine using the little ones again this is so much faster and gets them perfectly golden every time. I love that I can make two at time. Huge help when you're serving a large group.
customer_reviews.author: NC Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I love my cuisinart waffle maker, it works as intended and seems durable, and will last a long time as long as you turn the iron in the direction indicated on the handles of the waffle iron. I have used waffle mixes as well as made from scratch recipes and they both turned out well. While i oiled it the very first time, i have not oiled the waffle maker since, and the waffles still pop out easy as the first time. The non-stick coating works well and if you use a silicone spatula, you'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence S.

customer_reviews.title: It makes pretty large waffles
customer_reviews.text: I used this Christmas morning, and you have to keep on top of it. It makes pretty large waffles, but I suggest getting a small plastic cup that portions the batter better. I would spray with Pam each use. The waffles can stick, but a spatula/fork can loosen them off. Also great to make ahead. After they cool off, freeze them! I have a half every morning after I put the two quarters in the toaster!
customer_reviews.author: Nile

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is great! We love waffles and have a large family so making 2 at once is perfect! My only negative is I wish there was a tray or something to catch dripping butter when you turn it. Not a big deal though because the bottom isn't hard to wipe off.
customer_reviews.author: April Laue

customer_reviews.title: Great double waffle iron! Feed everyone in half the time!
customer_reviews.text: The double waffles are a must in our family of 6. The last one we tried didn’t have a “how-done” preference control. This one does and I really enjoy being able to set it how Crunchy/soft we each like it. Also, this one has separate lights to show when they are each done and beep separately to let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love this Cuisinart waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: We love this Cuisinart waffle iron. One of our favorites is just adding lemon extract and poppy seeds to Pamela's gluten free waffle mix. Then we top it with strawberries and strawberry syrup and whipped cream. Sooooo gooooood. We use a little bit of olive oil cooking spray once it is hot, and brush it around to lightly coat the surface. When done, we let the waffle iron cool down, then wipe with a dry paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: DeDi

product_meta.title: Cuisinart WAF-F20 Double Belgian Maker Waffle Iron, Silver
product_meta.description: The Cuisinart Double Belgian Waffle Maker expertly bakes two 1-inch extra-deep, restaurant-style waffles at the same time. Just add syrup or fruit and enjoy a luxurious breakfast or special dessert right at home! The easy-to-handle rotary feature flips each waffle 180 degrees to ensure even cooking on top and bottom. A 6-setting browning control knob ensures both waffles are cooked to order, from light and fluffy to crisp and brown. LED lights and audio beep tones indicate when unit is ready to cook and when waffles are done. And the nonstick coating wipes clean, providing no mess and easy cleanup, plus effortless food release. It's the perfect gift or perfect addition to any kitchen! The voltage for this unit is 120 volts. Features: Professional quality for home use|Bakes two Belgian waffles at a time|Extra-deep 1-inch waffle pockets|Nonstick coated waffle grids easily release waffles and make cleaning effortless|Easy-to-handle rotary feature for even baking on top and bottom|1400 watts of power|2 LED ready indicator lights and 3 audio beep tones signal when each waffle is done|Browning control knob|Limited One Year Product Warranty
feature_bullets: Creates two deep-pocket 1-inch Belgian waffles at the same time. Dimensions : 15.50 L x 9.75 W x 9.30 H inches. Cord length : 36 Inches
Included components: Measuring Cup, Waffle maker unit
1400 watts of power. UC Cubic Feet: 1. 08
Nonstick coating for quick food release and easy cleanup

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,781 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
